title: Jake Tapper to lawmaker: What world do you live in?
description: CNN's Jake Tapper talks with Rep. Eric Swalwell (D-CA) about whether John Bolton will testify at President Trump's Senate impeachment trial.

title: Photo of Trump Jr. holding rifle bearing image of Clinton behind bars raises flags
description: A photo of President Donald Trump's oldest son smiling while holding a semi-automatic rifle bearing medieval symbols and a cartoon of Hillary Clinton behind bars drew swift attention over the weekend, with hate group researchers pointing out that the medieval symbols have been embraced by extremist groups.

title: Astronomers discover giant wave-shaped structure in the Milky Way
description: Our solar system resides in one of the Milky Way galaxy's spiral arms, and for the first time, astronomers have realized we're close to a giant wave-shaped gaseous structure that connects star nurseries.

title: Top Facebook exec: Yes, we got Trump elected and it may happen again
description: A Facebook executive who backed Hillary Clinton's 2016 election campaign told colleagues in an internal memo last month that the platform could ultimately be responsible for President Trump's reelection.

title: Brad Pitt's 'happy place' is highly relatable
description: Brad Pitt's had a rough few years.

title: Gwyneth Paltrow's Goop is coming to Netflix
description: Netflix's "The Goop Lab" will feature Gwyneth Paltrow and her team trying out the "adventurous" wellness practice that made her brand famous... and controversial.

title: 'World's most expensive wine' hails from Hungary with eye-watering price tag
description: There's no denying that good wine comes with a price, but $40,000 seems rather steep.

title: Famous Puerto Rico landmark collapses after earthquake
description: "Punta Ventana" in Guayanilla, Puerto Rico, collapsed on January 6, after a 5.8 magnitude earthquake.

title: Elon Musk busts a move in Shanghai
description: Watch Elon Musk dance on stage during a Tesla event at the company's factory in Shanghai.

title: Mom has two sets of twins in one year
description: A woman in Florida who gave birth to twin boys in March 2019 soon learned she was again pregnant with twins in May 2019.

title: See massive tuna sold for $1.8 million
description: Kiyoshi Kimura, a self-described "Tuna King," spent a staggering sum on a bluefin tuna at Tokyo's Toyosu fish market.

title: Michelle Obama launches Instagram TV series
description: Former first lady Michelle Obama is partnering with media company ATTN: to launch an Instagram TV series called "A Year of Firsts."

title: How Somalia's pirates were stopped
description: Not so long ago, the coast of Somalia was plagued by pirates.

title: Willem Dafoe on forty years of acting: 'I'm a gunslinger. A nomad.'
description: "Scrubbed." That's the word Willem Dafoe used to describe his digitally "de-aged" appearance for flashback scenes in "Aquaman." (He played Nuidis Vulko, a mentor to the titular superhero.)

title: The two words that could tip the debate on Iran -- and help decide the next election
description: The fierce political debate over President Donald Trump's decision to order the killing of a top Iranian military leader ultimately may turn on just two words.

title: BAFTA nominations announced
description: The nominations for the UK's 2020 BAFTA Film Awards were announced Tuesday, with "Joker" being shortlisted in 11 categories.

title: Liverpool announces worst kept secret in football
description: Liverpool has announced Nike will become its new kit manufacturer from the 2020-21 season in a deal worth a reported $39.5 million per year.

title: Chris Hemsworth pledges $1 million to fight Australia's bushfires
A 6.4 magnitude earthquake hit Puerto Rico a day after another quake rocked the island
description: A 6.5 magnitude earthquake rocked Puerto Rico early Tuesday morning, just one day after a 5.8 magnitude quake shook the island, according to the United States Geological Service earthquake map.

title: British teen found guilty of lying about being gang-raped in a Cyprus resort town
description: A British teenager has been handed a four-month suspended jail sentence, after being found guilty of lying about being gang-raped in a Cyprus resort town last summer.

title: Iran and impeachment drama create huge clash for Trump
New pressures greet Pelosi following Bolton's willingness to testify
description: Washington is once again awaiting House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's next chess move as she returns to Capitol Hill on Tuesday, continuing to withhold the articles of impeachment from the US Senate while attempting to place another check on President Donald Trump to address his actions on Iran.

title: New study to monitor ex-soccer stars for early signs of dementia
description: Researchers have launched a new study which hopes to better understand the link between playing soccer and developing dementia.

title: Formula E boss hopes racing series will 'accelerate' adoption of electric vehicles
description: Electric racing series Formula E is at the vanguard of promoting a greener sport and its new boss believes it will benefit the planet as a whole.

title: Aston Martin's troubles mount as profits slump by 45%
description: Aston Martin stunned investors Tuesday by warning that its profit for 2019 would drop by about 45% despite healthy orders for its first ever SUV.

title: A number of people died during a funeral procession for Iranian commander in his hometown, Iran's Press TV says
Tom Hanks' son Chet is filmed speaking patois, and everyone is baffled
NASA astronaut shares beautiful image of 2020's first meteor shower
description: An astronaut on board the International Space Station had a front row view of "shooting stars" lighting up the sky over the Northern Hemisphere last weekend.

title: Iconic music venue in London is engulfed in flames
description: Firefighters battled a blaze at the under restoration music venue Koko in London on Monday night, according to fire officials.

title: Iranian foreign minister accuses US of 'state terrorism'
description: Iran's Foreign Minister Javad Zarif called US President Donald Trump's decision to order the drone strike that killed the country's top military commander an act of "state terrorism" in an interview with CNN Tuesday.

title: Iranian foreign minister accuses US of 'state terrorism'
description: Iran Foreign Minster Javad Zarif says President Donald Trump doesn't care about international law and is prepared to commit war crimes by threatening to destroy Iran's cultural sites.

title: Is it safe to travel to Australia now?
description: As bushfires continue to rage across Australia, with scenes of glowing red skies and scorched landscapes filling social media feeds around the world, travelers planning to visit the country in the coming weeks are likely wondering whether they should cancel or postpone their plans.

title: World's largest ice and snow festival kicks off in China
description: If you think enduring teeth-chattering cold is part of the fun when you travel, then the Harbin International Ice and Snow Sculpture Festival is the carnival for you.

title: Australian couple returns 'home' to find smoking ruin where their house once stood
description: Field after field of charred trees line a dirt road leading deep into the Australian bush, west of the coastal New South Wales town of Eden.

title: Up to 23 feet long, the Chinese paddlefish was the giant of the Yangtze. And we killed it
description: The Chinese paddlefish, one of the largest freshwater fish species which had survived for millions of years, has been declared extinct, according to new research by fisheries experts in China.

title: Philippines vulnerable to any Mideast conflict
A mysterious virus has China (and the rest of Asia) on edge
description: Chinese health authorities have not been able to identify a mysterious strain of pneumonia that has infected dozens of people and put the rest of Asia on alert -- although they have ruled out a return of the deadly severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) virus.

title: A lesson for Kim Jong Un in the death of Qasem Soleimani
description: In the dog days of 2017, when it appeared North Korea and the United States were on the path to war, a debate raged in the halls of the White House.

title: There's a pork shortage, and Impossible Foods is launching plant-based sausage
description: Impossible Foods, known for its meatless burgers, is launching plant-based pork.

title: China doesn't want war, but Trump's strike against Iran could present an opportunity to Beijing
description: Located thousands of feet up in the Central Asian mountains, Bishkek is not usually considered a place where international policy is made.

title: Iran and impeachment stir huge clash in Washington
description: The chaotic aftermath of the US strike against Iran and a shock turn in Donald Trump's impeachment drama are triggering a monumental Capitol Hill clash over trust and presidential power.

title: John Bolton still wants to talk -- here's why it matters
description: President Donald Trump's former national security adviser John Bolton announced in an unexpected and newsworthy statement Monday that he is prepared to testify if issued a subpoena as part of a Senate impeachment trial.

title: Lawmaker doesn't apologize for sharing fake Obama image
description: CNN's Chris Cuomo and Don Lemon take Rep. Paul Gosar (R-AZ) to task for sharing a fake photo of former President Barack Obama shaking hands with Iranian President Hassan Rouhani.

title: Anderson Cooper responds to press secretary's accusation
description: CNN's Anderson Cooper discusses the disappearance of the White House daily press briefings.

title: Nissan says it will still pursue legal action against Carlos Ghosn
description: Nissan said Tuesday that it will pursue "appropriate legal action" against its former boss Carlos Ghosn, despite his incredible escape from Japan.

title: SpaceX kicks off a busy year with launch of 60 more Starlink satellites into space
description: SpaceX launched its third batch of internet-beaming satellites Monday evening, kicking off what is expected to be a remarkably busy year for the company as it readies its new broadband business.

title: Trump's strike may have undone it all
description: • Analysis: Trump rekindles 'madman' theory

title: Why Trump can't be trusted on Iran
description: The US airstrike that killed Iranian Maj. Gen. Qasem Soleimani in Baghdad lacked two key elements that any American military strategy must have: the trust of the American people and allies to back us up.

title: First potentially habitable Earth-size planet discovered nearby
description: NASA's planet-hunting mission TESS has found its first potentially habitable exoplanet the size of Earth orbiting a star about 100 light-years from Earth, according to the agency.

title: GOP Senator: You'd have to be brain-dead to believe that
description: Sen. Rand Paul (R-KY) talks with CNN's Wolf Blitzer about President Donald Trump's decision to kill Iranian general Qasem Soleimani.
